oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Video - 1949 Clean-Up, Fix-Up Campaign
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: beautification; City Beautiful Commission; entertainment; events; pageants; parades; 1940s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A film from the 1949 Memphis Clean-Up, Paint-Up, Fix-Up Campaign. Highlights include the Miss City Beautiful beauty pageant, a train tour of Memphis, and a "follies" show at a community center.

1949 Film Log (taken from title cards within film)
00:01 - “Memphis, Tennessee the ‘Nation’s Cleanest City’ - Reception at Hotel Peabody in tribute for winning ‘Nation’s Cleanest City’ trophy.” 1940s City Beautiful Commission parties events fashion
04:42 - “Plans for 1949 campaign are discussed by Mayor and President of the Memphis Chamber of Commerce.” Overton, Watkins Robertson, Caffey
05:29 - “Chairman and Co-chairman outline program for 1949 campaign.” Fowler, Margaret Burks, O. O. Fredericks, Robert S.
06:04 - “City Beautiful Commission staff prepares for campaign.” women offices
07:25 - “Campaign is officially opened with Kick-Off luncheon.” events dining Overton, Watkins Fowler, Margaret Robertson, Caffey Burks, O. O.
08:57 - “Gala parade down Main Street attracts huge crowd.” (Main and Court) parades Main Street The Style Shop National Shirt Shops Walgreen Drugs Darling Shop marching bands majorettes Oak Hall Memphis Fire Department Memphis Park Commission
11:08 - “Hundreds of playground children take part in colorful costumes.” children Peabody Community Center tractors Boy Scouts Bellevue Jr. High crossing guards Court Square Longview Heights Civic Club
14:30 - “‘Miss City Beautiful’ and contestants ride attractive float and cars.” [sic] Sanders, Betty automobiles Health Department Memphis Department of Public Works Salvation Army
19:10 - “Prizes are awarded parade winners.” [sic]
20:29 - “Forty-eight attractive girls enter ‘Miss City Beautiful’ contest.” women beauty pageants
20:54 - “Contestants parade before the judges.”
23:21 - “Bouquets are presented to the three finalists.”
23:53 - “The winner - Miss Betty Sanders - ‘Miss City Beautiful’ of 1949”
25:44 - “Five bus loads of prominent citizens depart on Rehabilitation Bus Tour.” Peabody Hotel buses
26:46 - “Inspection is made of new four-lane highway bridge under construction.” Memphis-Arkansas Bridge Mississippi River
28:19 - “Guests visit one of Memphis’ outstanding flower gardens.” residences
29:29 - “Group views special painting project.” Madison Avenue Graham Apartments
30:36 - “Refreshments are enjoyed at City Beautiful Commission Headquarters.” (1430 Eastmoreland)
32:20 - “Plants and shrubs are exchanged at Garden Mart.”
35:50 - “Civic leaders take train tour to inspect railroad property and industrial areas.” Memphis-Arkansas Bridge industry railroads J.E. Dilworth Co. Front St. Warehouse Riverside Drive International Harvester Illinois Central Railroad public housing Desoto Paint and Varnish Co.
44:42 - “Clean-Up Campaign activities are explained at dinner for school principals.” dining
46:13 - “Committee inspects schools for fire hazards.” schools Bellevue Jr. High Memphis Fire Department
47:13 - “Unscheduled fire drills are held in all schools.” schools American Legion
48:39 - “Winners in Garden Club contest.” women awards
49:02 - “Winners in Health Department Inspection contest.” Phelan’s House Paint awards
49:54 - “Dr. Cu-Pu-Fu Follies performs in neighborhood community centers. Prizes were awarded and talks made on spring clean-up.” events entertainment community centers dance
58:39 - “Hundreds enjoyed Spuare Dance in downtown Public Square conducted by Junior Chamber of Commerce.” [sic] dancing Court Square Home Federal Savings & Loan Marx & Bensdorf Brass Rail Restaurant
01:04:12 - “‘Miss City Beautiful’ appears before many service luncheon clubs, and urges their cooperation in campaign.” Exchange Club Co-operative Club Lion’s Club Jr. Chamber of Commerce
01:06:04 - “‘Miss City Beautiful’ takes part in radio and television programs.”
